transcript:
Michael Ilari6n- ovich?" said the Emperor Alexander hurried- ly to Kutuzov, glancing courteously at the same time at the Emperor Francis. 
"I am waiting, Your Majesty," answered Ku- tuzov, bending forward respectfully. 
The Emperor, frowning slightly, bent his ear forward as if he had not quite heard. 
"Waiting, Your Majesty," repeated Kutiizov. (Prince Andrew noted that Kutiizov's upper lip twitched unnaturally as he said the word "waiting.") "Not all the columns have formed up yet, Your Maje
